titleStmt.title: John A. Hays et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2366

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Tho his Excellency Beriah Magoffin,
The Governor of Kentucky

A vacancy now exists in this, (Hays' Springs) District, for Magistrate or "Justice of the Peace" occasioned by the death of Isaac Mills; now we the undersigned pray your Excellency to fill said vacancy, and earnestly recommend our fellow citizen Oliver. C. Curry as every way qualified and worthy of said office

I, Jno. A. Hays J. P. J C. do hereby certify that Isaac Mills was my colleague as acting "Justice of the Peace" for this Hays' Springs" District for the County of Jefferson and state of Kentucky- and that he has departed this life

Jno. A. Hays J. P. J. C
Bland B. McKeaig
J, H, Leatherman
S M Hobbs
Chas Hays
Jonathan McKoaig
Henry Mckeaig
Levi. Frederick
Deiming the above names sufficient I remain respectfully yours

Hon. B. Magoffin
Gov. Kentucky
Nov 21st 1860
Richard Fryer
Tillotson Neel
Andrew. J. Miller
Peter W Hayes
James Grigsby
Wm Thirton
Sampson Wigginton
Jas. R. Hall
A P Hayes
M. W, Wakefield
Jacob Wise
Henry. A. Hays
Buford. Gentry

J. P.
Hays Spring Dist
O. C. Curry
vice
J. Mills decd
Nov. 27. 1860
